intro: Rhytiglossa dasyclados var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth-leafed rhytiglossa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Zingiberaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The varietal name "glaberrima" refers to its smooth, hairless leaf surface, distinguishing it from other varieties in the species.
